alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lexington and central Richland Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 626 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oak Grove, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Springdale, St. Andrews, Red Bank, Dentsville, Oak Grove, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Arcadia Lakes, Columbia International University, Killian, Harbison State Forest, Riverbanks Zoo, SC State Farmer`s Market, and Woodfield. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 54 and 80. Interstate 26 between mile markers 103 and 118. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
